metadata.subject: A Resource Guide to the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act
metadata.sender: Lanny A. Breuer (Assistant Attorney General, Criminal Division, DOJ) and Robert S. Khuzami (Director of Enforcement, SEC)

organizations: United States and Foreign Commercial Service
Bureau of Economic and Business Affairs
Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs
Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development

relationships.description: Joint enforcement authority for FCPA with DOJ handling criminal enforcement and SEC handling civil enforcement
Collaboration on global anti-corruption efforts through various international conventions and working groups

analysis.purpose: To provide comprehensive guidance to businesses and individuals about FCPA compliance, enforcement priorities, and best practices
analysis.significance: Official joint guidance from DOJ and SEC representing their enforcement approach to the FCPA, intended to help companies prevent violations and implement effective compliance programs

notable_quotes: Corporate bribery is bad business. In our free market system it is basic that the sale of products should take place on the basis of price, quality, and service.
Corruption impedes economic growth by diverting public resources from important priorities such as health, education, and infrastructure.
An effective compliance program is a critical component of a company's internal controls and is essential to detecting and preventing FCPA violations.
red_flags: Lack of senior management commitment to compliance

blackmail_indicators.description: Document is an official guidance publication about legal compliance, containing no indications of blackmail or coercion

illegal_activity.description: This is an official government guidance document explaining legal requirements and compliance practices, not evidence of illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: This is an officially published guidance document from DOJ and SEC that is publicly available on government websites and represents well-known enforcement policy

analysis.summary: This is the official FCPA Resource Guide jointly published by the DOJ and SEC in 2012, providing comprehensive guidance on the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act including anti-bribery provisions, accounting requirements, enforcement principles, compliance programs, and international anti-corruption efforts. The guide is intended to help businesses understand and comply with FCPA requirements through practical advice and legal explanations.
